official-title.#text:
To establish dual language education programs in
		  low-income communities.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Providing Resources to Improve Dual
			 Language Education Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds the following:

text.#text: The

Dual language
			 programs have been found to provide the greatest academic gains for limited
			 English proficient children.

Few children from
			 low-income communities, particularly African-American children, have had access
			 to a well-developed and well-implemented dual language program.

Children in dual
			 language programs experience substantial gains in language, literacy, and
			 mathematics.

The
			 purposes of this section are as follows:

To provide incentives for local educational
			 agencies to develop innovative strategies for working with low-income and
			 limited English proficient children.

To improve the school readiness of
			 low-income and limited English proficient children and to ensure they enter
			 school ready to succeed.

To provide consistent support for learning
			 through high-quality dual language programs from preschool through the fifth
			 grade.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to carry out a demonstration project to enhance the biliteracy and
			 bilingualism skills for children in impoverished communities, including limited
			 English proficient and minority children, through the use and longitudinal
			 evaluation of dual language programs beginning in preschool through the fifth
			 grade.

text.#text: To authorize the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and after
			 reserving funds under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Providing Resources to Improve Dual Language Education Act of 2013/s:3/ss:i

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Providing Resources to Improve Dual Language Education Act of 2013/s:3/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to award not
			 more than five grants to fund partnerships of local educational agencies, early
			 childhood education programs including State-funded preschool programs and Head
			 Start programs, and technical assistance providers to demonstrate effective
			 strategies in ensuring the academic success of low-income minority students
			 through the implementation and evaluation of a high-quality dual language
			 program that—

text.#text: From funds made available under

establishes an
			 infrastructure that supports a rigorous assessment system, including dedicated
			 staff time and professional development in assessment, a data collection plan,
			 and the collection of multiple measures of academic progress, bilingualism, and
			 biliteracy;

aligns
			 professional development and training for early childhood education instructors
			 and elementary school teachers and staff, with an emphasis on dual language
			 instruction, second language acquisition, and content knowledge;

recruits, trains,
			 and continuously develops staff to implement high-quality, dual language
			 programs; and

establishes a
			 responsive infrastructure for positive, active, and ongoing relationships with
			 students’ families and the community that responds to and is reflective of the
			 needs of the community and goals of the program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall reserve not more than 5 percent of the amount appropriated
			 under

to carry out this Act, including the technical assistance
			 and evaluation described is

			 described in

Providing Resources to Improve Dual Language Education Act of 2013/s:3/ss:h

text.#text: The

Each
			 grant under this section shall be awarded for a period of not more than five
			 years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
at such time and in such manner as

may require.

text.#text:
Each eligible entity desiring a grant under this section
			 shall submit an application to the

Each application submitted by a partnership under
			 this section for a proposed program shall include documentation that—

the partnership
			 has partnered with an entity that has proven expertise in the implementation of
			 high-quality dual language programs to provide on-going technical assistance
			 and assist with the evaluation of the program;

the partnership
			 has the qualified personnel to develop, administer, evaluate, and implement the
			 program; and

the partnership is
			 serving economically disadvantaged minority and limited English proficient
			 children.

Each application submitted by an entity
			 under this section for a proposed program shall include—

a description of
			 how the program will be evaluated to assess the goals of the program;

a description of
			 how the evaluation will be used to inform broader efforts to improve
			 instruction for limited English proficient children, including for
			 preschool-aged children;

a description of
			 activities that will be pursued by the program including a description
			 of—

how
			 the activities will further the school readiness and academic progress of
			 children served by this program and support dual language development through
			 grade five;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
such information as may be
			 required by
; and

an assurance that

any other

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: such sums as may be necessary for each of the 4 succeeding fiscal years

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Providing Resources to Improve Dual Language Education Act of 2013/s:3

text.#text:
In
			 this section:

term.#tail:
means an
			 instructional strategy in which students are taught literacy and content in two
			 languages and use the partner language for at least half of the instructional
			 day and foster bilingualism, biliteracy, enhanced awareness of linguistic and
			 cultural diversity, and high levels of academic achievement through instruction
			 in two languages.

text.#text: The term
The term

serves children
			 who are ages 3 through 5;

has a primary
			 focus of supporting early childhood education, including supporting children’s
			 cognitive, social, emotional, and physical development and approaches to
			 learning;

helps prepare
			 children for a successful transition to kindergarten;

is either a
			 school- or community-based program; and

is funded either
			 in whole or in part by a State through a State agency with authority to
			 promulgate regulations and monitor participating programs.

term.#tail:
, when
			 used with respect to a child, means a child—

text.#text: The term

who was not born in the
			 United States or whose native language is a language other than English;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ); and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9101

text.#text:
who is a Native American
			 (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
), an Alaska Native, or a native resident of an outlying
			 area (as defined in such

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 9101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of
			 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9101

text.#text:
who comes from an environment
			 where a language other than English has had a significant impact on the child’s
			 level of English language proficiency; or

who is migratory, whose native
			 language is a language other than English, and who comes from an environment
			 where a language other than English is dominant; and

whose difficulties
			 in speaking or understanding the English language may be sufficient to deny the
			 child—

the
			 ability to successfully achieve in a classroom in which the language of
			 instruction is English; or

the
			 opportunity to participate fully in society.
